data.enText: to ask sb for sth especially in an anxious way because you want or need it very much
They begged him for help.

data.chText: 我设法求得一位开车路过的人让我搭车。
data.enText: I managed to beg a lift from a passing motorist.
She begged permission to leave.

data.chText: 他想亲眼看着他们求饶。
data.enText: He wants to see them beg for mercy.

data.chText: 别把我扔在这儿，求求你！
data.enText: Don't leave me here, I beg of you!

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: She begged him not to go.
He begged to be told the truth.

data.chText: “再给我一次机会吧。”他恳求道。
data.enText: ‘Give me one more chance,’ he begged.
She begged that she be allowed to go.
She begged that she should be allowed to go.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+直接引语

data.enText: to ask sb for money, food, etc., especially in the street

data.chText: 伦敦大街上到处都是无家可归的乞丐。
data.enText: London is full of homeless people begging in the streets.
The children were begging for food.
a begging letter (= one that asks sb for money)

data.chText: 我们设法向咖啡馆老板讨了一顿饭。
data.enText: We managed to beg a meal from the cafe owner.

data.chText: （狗蹲坐在后腿上将前爪抬起）等食物
data.enText: if a dog begs , it sits on its back legs with its front legs in the air, waiting to be given sth
beg leave to do sth
to ask sb for permission to do sth
be going begging
if sth is going begging , it is available because nobody else wants it
beg sb's pardon
to ask sb to forgive you for sth you have said or done
beg the question
to make sb want to ask a question that has not yet been answered

data.chText: 所有这一切都令人想到究竟由谁来投资该工程的问题。
data.enText: All of which begs the question as to who will fund the project.
to talk about sth as if it were definitely true, even though it might not be

data.chText: 这些假设想当然地认为儿童比成年人学习语言容易。
data.enText: These assumptions beg the question that children learn languages more easily than adults.
I beg to differ
used to say politely that you do not agree with sth that has just been said
I beg your pardon
used to tell sb that you are sorry for sth you have said or done

data.chText: 对不起，我还以为那是我的外衣呢。
data.enText: I beg your pardon, I thought that was my coat.
used to ask sb to repeat what they have just said because you did not hear

data.chText: “是在公爵大街上。”“请再说一遍。”“公爵大街。”
data.enText: ‘It's on Duke Street.’ ‘I beg your pardon.’ ‘Duke Street.’
used to tell sb that you are offended by what they have just said or by the way that they have said it
‘Just go away.’ ‘I beg your pardon!’
beg off

data.chText: 推辞（已答应做的事）；反悔
data.enText: to say that you are unable to do sth that you have agreed to do

data.chText: 他总是在最后一分钟反悔。
data.enText: He's always begging off at the last minute.

means: (狗蹲坐在后腿上将前爪抬起)等食物

ex.chText: 当地的那个非政府环保组织恳请政府提供帮助。
ex.enText: That local environmental non-governmental organization pleaded for government help.

ex.chText: 那对双胞胎恳求苏珊留下。
ex.enText: The twins pleaded with Susan to stay.

ex.chText: 反对派领导人呼吁保持冷静。
你可以吁请董事会提供帮助。
ex.enText: You can appeal to the board for help.

ex.chText: 很多非政府组织都呼吁公众捐款。
ex.enText: Many non-governmental organizations have appealed to the public to donate money.

synonyms.bx: 指严肃、公开地请求给予帮助、信息、钱款等。

ex.chText: 她想冲到前男友面前乞求他原谅。
ex.enText: She wanted to run to her ex-boyfriend and beg his forgiveness.

ex.chText: 他跑到最近的教堂恳求帮助。
ex.enText: He ran to the nearest church and begged for help.

synonyms.bx: 指焦急、迫切地恳求，含有低三下四的意味。

ex.enText: She implored the landlord to reduce the rent.

ex.chText: 约翰，我求你快帮她，要不然她就要破产了。
ex.enText: John, I implore you, help her now before she goes broke.

synonyms.bx: 指焦急或动情地乞求某事物，或恳求某人做或不做某事，有时用于文学作品中。

ex.chText: 村民请愿要求地方政府提供更便利的医疗服务。
ex.enText: Villagers petitioned the local government to provide more convenient medical services.

ex.chText: 政府官员不明白为什么居民要请愿反对修建那条新道路。
ex.enText: Government officials didn't understand why residents petitioned against the new road.

synonyms.bx: 通常指向政府或组织请愿。

if sth is going begging , it is available because nobody else wants it

data.enText: All of which begs the question as to who will fund the project.

data.enText: These assumptions beg the question that children learn languages more easily than adults.

data.enText: I beg your pardon, I thought that was my coat.

data.enText: ‘It's on Duke Street.’ ‘I beg your pardon.’ ‘Duke Street.’
used to tell sb that you are offended by what they have just said or by the way that they have said it
‘Just go away.’ ‘I beg your pardon!’
beg off

data.chText: 推辞（已答应做的事）；反悔
data.enText: to say that you are unable to do sth that you have agreed to do

data.chText: 他总是在最后一分钟反悔。
data.enText: He's always begging off at the last minute.

tr: make a solicitation or entreaty for something
example: Henry IV solicited the Pope for a divorce
My neighbor keeps soliciting money for different charities

tr: dodge, avoid answering, or take for granted
example: beg the point in the discussion

value.def: If you beg someone to do something, you ask them very anxiously or eagerly to do it.

example.ex: I begged him to come back to England with me...
example.tran: 我恳求他和我一起回英格兰。

example.ex: I begged to be allowed to leave...
We are not going to beg for help any more...
They dropped to their knees and begged forgiveness.

value.def: If someone who is poor is begging, they are asking people to give them food or money.

example.ex: I was surrounded by people begging for food...
example.tran: 我被一群讨饭的围住了。

example.ex: There are thousands like him in Los Angeles, begging on the streets and sleeping rough...
example.tran: 洛杉矶有数以千计像他这样的人，沿街乞讨，露宿街头。

example.ex: She was living alone, begging food from neighbors.
example.tran: 她孑然一身，向邻居们讨饭吃。

value.def: You say 'I beg to differ' when you are politely emphasizing that you disagree with someone.
If you say that something is going begging, you mean that it is available but no one is using it or accepting it.

example.ex: There is other housing going begging in town.
example.tran: 城里还有些住宅无人问津。

value.def: If you say that something begs a particular question, you mean that it makes people want to ask that question; some people consider that this use is incorrect.

example.ex: Hopewell's success begs the question: why aren't more companies doing the same?
example.tran: 霍普韦尔的成功让人不禁要问：为什么其他公司不效仿呢？

value.tran: 引起疑问，使人想问（一些人认为此用法不正确）

value.def: If you say that something begs a particular question, you mean that it assumes that the question has already been answered and so does not deal with it.

example.ex: The research begs a number of questions.

value.tran: （认为问题已获解决而）绕过问题

trans: 乞讨（食物、钱等）；恳求，乞求
请原谅，请某人再说一遍
